question: Can I practice yoga if Iâ€™m not flexible?
answer:
Absolutely! We do not practice yoga because we are flexible, we are flexible because we practice yoga. It takes time and lots of practice to release tight muscles, and even if you are stiff as a stick, each yoga pose can be modified to suit your individual body needs. And we can always use pops to help get into the shapes of each pose. 
Flexibility should be a long-term goal, not a barrier to hold you back from the benefits of yoga!

question: What should I wear?
answer: Wear anything comfortable that allows you to move freely. Leggings or loose shorts work great. If you are prone to sweating, wear light clothes.

question: Am I too old for yoga?
answer: Never! We offer gentle yoga classes that can help you develop flexibility and improve range of motion. This is important to prevent injuries down the road. Just work within your abilities and progress at your own rate. A little goes a long way!

question: Is the teacher going to touch me?
answer: The instructor will often walk around the room to guide those who need it and will touch you only with your permission. A slight touch can be beneficial to improve your pose alignment or help you notice where you are holding tension. If this makes you uncomfortable, just communicate it to the instructor when she asks at the beginning of the class.

question: Can I eat before yoga practice?
answer: It is best to eat at least one hour before the class to allow the body to digest the meal. A light snack just before class is fine. Listen to your body to know what works best for you.

question: Will yoga conflict with my religion?
answer: Our yoga classes does not conflict with religion. We focus on the mind and body practice. Our lessons combine physical postures, breathing exercises, and focusing practices of mindfulness and relaxation.

question: How often should I practice yoga?
answer: A healthy practice is usually around 3-5 times a week. This allows your body to rest and recover from strenuous exercises. If you only practice a gentle form of yoga, you can do so every day. The key is to listen to your body.

question: Can I practice yoga if I am overweight?
answer: Yes, you can practice yoga at any weight, size, and fitness level. We will help you adjust poses and positions to accommodate your body type and shape.

question: What yoga style should I practice?
answer:
There are many forms of yoga.  Choosing a style that best suits your interests will depend on many factors: age, current level and type of other activity/exercise, temperature preference, fitness goals and your temperament.

Some yoga is fast paced, while other forms are slow. Experiment with different styles of classes! Make sure to look at our class descriptions to find the style of yoga that is right for you.

question: Can yoga help me lose weight?
answer: Yes, yoga can help you lose weight. The gentle postures coupled with mindful breathing help to detoxify the body, cleanse the digestive tract, and decrease anxiety and stress. Yoga provides a gentle form of exercise that can strengthen the body and tone your muscles.
